noun.description: Grass and the surface layer of earth held together by its roots.
examples: they walked across the springy turf
he spent his money gambling on the turf

noun.description: An area regarded as someone's personal territory; one's home ground.
examples: the team will play Canada on their home turf this summer
they were turfed off the bus

verb.description: Cover (a patch of ground) with turf.

origin: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch turf and German Torf, from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit darbha tuft of grass.
